problem_text:
20.71. (J. Lauri). A card of a finite simple undirected graph G of order n = |V (G)| is an induced subgraph of order n −1. Let k be 2, 3, 4. For a connected graph G with k isomorphism types of cards, can Aut(G) have more than k orbits on the vertex set V (G)?
If a graph G has k isomorphism types of cards, then the group Aut(G) of automorphisms of G has obviously at least k orbits on V (G). It is known that if all cards are mutually isomorphic, then Aut(G) is transitive on V (G). Examples are known of graphs G with 5 isomorphism types of cards for which Aut(G) has 6 orbits on V (G), and of graphs with 6 isomorphism types for which Aut(G) has 7 orbits on V (G).
V. Pannone
